intro: Hancornia speciosa var. pubescens, commonly known as the silver star, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy, pubescent leaves that give it its varietal name, and it produces large, fleshy fruits that contain edible seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
